Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of consumer complaints by suggesting that the label was changed solely due to offensive images, without providing evidence of the extent of the complaints or their influence on the decision.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the label depicted offensive images without providing evidence or alternative perspectives on the interpretation of the images.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or details to support the assertion that consumers complained about offensive images on the label.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the label may have been changed, such as marketing strategies or rebranding efforts unrelated to consumer complaints.
